In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(input::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(input, ' ')
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line = isempty(current_line) ? word : string(current_line, ' ', word)
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)  # append the remaining words in the last line
    return join(lines, '\n')
end
```

This function splits the input string into a list of words and then iterates over them. For each word, it checks if adding it to the `current_line` would make the length exceed `text_width`. If so, it adds `current_line` to the list of lines and starts a new line with the current word. Finally, it joins all lines together using newline characters for the output string.

Here is an example:

```julia
input_string = "This is a very long text that needs to be wrapped within specified text width"
output_string = wrap_string(input_string, 10)
println(output_string)
```

